Posts.Title: How many of you felt a mass prior to getting tested? Hopefloatsagainandagain Cowboy-Up

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2017 03:05PM Hopefloatsagainandagain wrote: Thank you all for the replies. As a person waiting for a biopsy, I feel your stories calm me. There are so may different experiences, but an overwhelming feeling of togetherness. It makes me feel better about facing the results when I get them. Also, after I find my new normal, I would love to share some of these stories with friends and acquaintances as I preach the benefits of getting our mammograms regularly. Now, I just have to get over seeing a picture of my mass. It looks ominous. It is not all clean and encapsulated. It looks ugly. I know this doesn't bode well for negative results.  Angela
Posts.Title: How many of you felt a mass prior to getting tested? Hopefloatsagainandagain Cowboy-Up

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 01:59AM hopefloatsagain wrote: One thing you might consider is talking to a genetic counselor if you haven't already. The results could give you information in order to be more proactive. After going for the counseling with other members of my family, I finally feel like I am driving the bus!!!
